Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beweiss6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very nice hotel. The rooms was spacious with a very nice bathroom. The shower was amazing! The hotel lacks a bathroom in the lobby... The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bridgeclimber
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a Premier King room and enjoyed all the amenities the hotel offered. Very friendly staff, very good quality fresh breakfast, nice formal dining room plus use of business office. A car is pretty much a requirement(for areas beyond the 5 km. the hotel limousine covers) - would have liked the choice of self-parking v/s valet service, for constant coming and going; not happy when car delivered covered in bird droppings, however, it was cleaned promptly thereafter. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TJR3
Reviews.Content: I came to Dallas for a three day business conference. I brought my wife and intended on staying at the Ritz, but no rooms available. My wife suggested staying at the Mansion as she heard it was remodeled/renovated since the last time we stayed there. Anyway, our stay was perfect. We especially liked the outside patio bar!

Reviews.Title: “Personalized touch”
Reviews.Author: wileym1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family here over 4th July weekend. I wA working downtown Dallas over holiday while family had the entire hotel and staff to theirselves. Warm cookies and milk were deliverd to my children in bed by staff. On staff repair man helped kids get their pool toys working while I was at work. Great service. Made my dreaded working holiday go very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice mansion”
Reviews.Author: fbadaddallas
Reviews.Content: TRMOTC is certainly outstanding in many ways- some service shines with regard to valet, bellmen, the desk receptionist, housekeeping; the guest room is huge and spacious with the bath amenities by Lady Primrose being especially nice. But it is impossible for TRMOTC to live up to expectations: so what if the mattress was a tad lumpy, the turndown service for our room (where the hotel was privy to knowing my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary) with just one bottled water and one goblet; the cocktail waitress better suited for an upscale beer joint than a five-star hotel; all things considered, TRMOTC is still a wonderful place. (It is sad to see The Restaurant which for years was THE place to celebrate any special occasion in Dallas fall to what it appears to be now).

Reviews.Title: “Not the same, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LASGarcia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mansion on Turtle creek so many times, I cannot count. This last visit, while I still like the hotel very much, was slightly disappointing. The old-money Dallas charm has been replaced with mod uninteresting furniture and accents. I remember the beds being so comfortable, this time not at all. I had to call down for some house slippers, as I was used to them being available in the room before. I had room service and it was OK. During the night, I was woken up numerous times because the service door would slam shut with a bang. I did turn in a review, because I was underwhelmed and tired when I checked out and the GM sent me a free night stay, next time I am in Dallas- which I will definitely use. It was the correct thing to do, and I will hopefully have an update next time I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Budsysmrs
Reviews.Content: Although we were advised that this hotel is in demand and extremely popular, we found it to be 'charming and grand' more due to its old fashioned and 'outdated' feel (which is probably the attraction) but not really somewere we would return to. It is spotless and the staff are really helpful and friendly but we felt it was somewere more suited to a business trip as there were conferences being held, and as we were on vacation, felt a little out of place as a family travelling, not that anyone made us feel that way. The beds were really comfy and everywehere is spotless. We were on a lower floor so the view was really of the front courtyard but I am sure that the higher you get the view would be better. The hotel is sitiuated in the quiter part of Dallas but near enough to walk to local amenties (restaurants etc..).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jackie c
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for my daughter's play & stayed @ the Rosewood Mansion. We were impressed from the moment we pulled up to the entrance. Very friendly & attentive staff. We had the premier room, from the room's decor to the bathroom layout was just incredible, the waterfall like shower to the large tub, & the COMFY bed. I definitely recommend the car service if you don't want to drive locally, nothing like being driven around in a Jaguar, makes a statement. My boyfriend who serves in Afghanistan & has stayed @ hotels in Dubai, compares/rates the Rosewood Mansion among the 5 star hotels in Dubai. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Get a premier room or above”
Reviews.Author: llbGreensboroNc
Reviews.Content: I have loved the Mansion since it opened 30 years ago. And the service and outside are still fantastic. Sadly, the rooms and public spaces have been 'redone' and lost all charm and class that it once had. Worse, the lower rooms seem like caves with the new brown carpet. The rooms now look much like a really nice Hilton, but certainly not on the scale of Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. I am so sorry that they tried to go a 'modern' look for such a beautiful, historic hotel. Do not book a room in less than the Prestige category.. the lower rooms are noisy and smell like mold and must and even smoke. They are low ceilinged and dark. The good parts.. the service is still divine and the food terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: Seamless service from start to finish. I don't know how they do it, but the service is on par with any Four Seasons in the United States. I was most impressed that every staff member acknowledged me when in passing, and some even by name. The deluxe patio room was a good choice but unusable at night due to the streetlights, but a great place to relax in the daytime. The restaurant was a treat - great ambience, creative menu, flawless service, and definitely overpriced, but definitely worth it for the overall experience. Here's a tip for guests arriving by car and from out of town: the entrance is NOT on Turtle Creek Blvd. Enter from Gillespie street. Go figure. I would stay here again....and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: hlmom
Reviews.Content: The Mansion was amazing in terms of service. There is literally nothing the they miss! I think that they may actually have mind reading skills in regards to how they seem to anticipate your needs! The restaurant is also very good! My husband and I are pretty picky when it comes to food and really enjoyed the meal as well as the wine that the sommelier suggested. The only slight negative was the room. It was very clean but it seemed lacking in in some way. I understand that it is an old hotel, but it just seemed a bit outdated though admittedly large. Not sure if it would have helped if we would have upgraded a bit, but for as nice of a hotel as it is, one would think that it would have had that something special. The reason that I gave it an average for room is that in this price range based on room only and not the other amenities, I believe that was the proper rating.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay-not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: chrisperryman
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review. We stayed here for 4 days in 2009. We obtained an excellent value package through Luxury Link. This 5 diamond property is very good indeed from beautifully furnished suites, to incredible dining and gracious, attentive service. One cannot go wrong in choosing this exceptional property!

Reviews.Title: “Rosewood Mansion on Turtle Creek â€“ great hospitality and superb stay”
Reviews.Author: PeteandSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosewood Mansion on Turtle Creek in a Premier Room for 3 nights on our first trip to Dallas for our honeymoon. The staff were so welcoming and friendly from the moment we stepped foot into the hotel and from that moment onwards always greeted us by name. We were also given chocolate coated strawberries and iced tea on our arrival. Our room was amazing â€“ incredibly spacious, large bed and wonderful bathroom with beautiful amenities. The small things such as cotton wool and bath salts were a lovely touch. We were also given fresh bottles of water and ice each evening as part of the turndown service. Thereâ€™s a complimentary private car service that is able to take you anywhere within 5 miles â€“ a wonderful service that was a nice bonus. For those looking for a meal close by â€“ we recommend the Katy Trail Ice House (has a great beer garden with lots of Texas beers) and Cafe Brazil (good coffee and great breakfasts) â€“ both within walking distance from the hotel. We absolutely loved our stay at the Rosewood Mansion â€“ the friendly staff and beautiful settings will definitely ensure we stay there again if ever in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay at a five star at least once!”
Reviews.Author: cmarret
Reviews.Content: While I can't say that I'd stay here again (just because I'm not quite "ritzy" enough to do so) I did enjoy my likely once-in-a-lifetime stay at this five-star hotel. It gives you an idea of how the wealthy live. :) It's the little things that make a big difference... the fact that when you return to your room the bed is turned down, ice and water left, a delicious brownie awaits you along with a note from the room help with tomorrow's weather so that you can plan. Fine Italian linens drape the posturepedic bed (yes, we looked!) Each room has a large TV with DVD player, and the hotel keeps a library of DVDs for you to borrow. You can open the doors to your balcony and take in the fresh air. The hotel is, of course, elegantly decorated and the staff is abundant and available. I got a great deal on the hotel through one of the discount sites (you can get at least 30% off the regular room rate), and am glad that I got to feel like royalty for a night. :) If you'd really like to impress a gal, this would be the place to go. Be prepared with $25 for valet parking... which is mandatory unless you want to park a walk away on the street. And carry cash for all the people that help you at every turn. I would suggest dressing appropriately to stay at this hotel (I'd suggest no jeans) and definitely bring business attire if you plan to dine there.

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever”
Reviews.Author: Betty L
Reviews.Content: I am traveling a lot all over the world.in this hotel everybody makes feel you as a family.they do anything you want to feel comfortable and happy.they are all very polite.rooms excellent and clean.bathrooms exceptional.personnel great.limo service available to locations nearby if you do not want to drive.welcome apple cider, and cookies at the entrance excellent.It was little difficult to find the entrance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelbug05
Reviews.Content: The Mansion has been on my wish list for a while, so we decided to stay New Year's Eve. The hotel is beautiful and clean. Rooms were spacious and updated. We enjoy staying in nice hotels, but found the clientele in this one to be a bit "stuffy". Perhaps it was just the crowd that was there for New Year's. We had New Year's brunch in the restaurant the following morning, which was excellent. Very fresh ingredients! Overall, I was glad to have the experience, but for the price I will probably select a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay experience”
Reviews.Author: Movinon42
Reviews.Content: Following two weeks of moving from hotel to hotel in Canada and the USA I arrived in Dallas to spend my last night at Rosewood Mansion on Turtle Creek. This is truely a beautifull hotel set in a quite residential area. Arriving by car I was warmly welcomed at the front of the hotel and led inside to to reception for a friendly and professional checkin at the front desk, followed by the porter who on entering the room went out of his way to explain the room amenities to me. The rooms like the rest of the hotel exude a quite ambience that makes you feel welcome and comfortable. The bar was subdued with a warm and moody feel with great barmen and the dinner, that by the way you can have either in the restaurant or the bar was of excellent quality. Dare I say that after some weeks of "fry's"etc it was a delight to be served what I would describe as ""Cuisine Nouvelle" prepared by a truely professional chef. Wonderfull. Nothing was a bother to the staff here and I can only say that at any time in Dallas in the future I will be staying here. Without one of the best hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, spotless, elegant, friendly”
Reviews.Author: alspat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was spectacular and worth every dollar. Huge, spotless, comfortable rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Free limo service to local restaurants. Spa services were wonderful. Had an amazing dinner in the hotel restaurant. This hotel is first class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice.”
Reviews.Author: johnamance
Reviews.Content: We don't usually stay in 5 star hotels. I am a bargain shopper and usually only get 4 star hotels. We have stayed in tons of resorts all over the US and Caribbean, and I have never stayed in a place that I liked more. Overall, I thought it was great. We only used the bathrobes once, so I'm not sure if they replace them, but the shower and hot water and everything else was great. It is convenient to some places but not all. The bath salts and lotion was a really cool surprise. They even leave cotton balls and cue tips out for you. Not big things, but they made you feel welcome. I told them it was our anniversary and they sent up some chocolate covered strawberries and mango tea. I will most definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property But A Bit Out Of the Way”
Reviews.Author: JBHAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This property reminds me of the Hotel Bel Air, if you have ever been there. Small, intimate, eclectic with a feel that is more like stepping into a large guest house vs a resort or hotel property. It resides in Turtle Creek which has lovely trails nearby and is close to shopping but not within walking distance. There truly is not alot to do in the immediate vicinity of the Mansion, but a 5-10 minute drive will take to you to the best shopping Dallas has to offer. The staff is helpful and attentive and the restaurant is very nice. Since Dean Fearing left years ago, it has never been the same. I think this is a wonderful property but for me, the Ritz Carlton Dallas is by far a better choice as the staff, the rooms, the restaurant and the spa really left a lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable property”
Reviews.Author: Snowman321
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed every aspect of this property, and I look forward to returning soon. The check-in was flawless; the service (and food) at both the bar and in the breakfast room were great; my guest room was very well appointed and had all of the creature comforts of a 5 star property, including a sound bar for an I-Pod, etc. My only complaint, which would not prevent me from returning, was the bathrooms. It seems that while the property put a lot of money into a hard and soft remodel of the lobby and guest rooms, nothing was done to remodel the bathrooms, which had a late 80's appearance, and harsh fluorescent lights. I also experienced the problem with hot/cold water noted recently in another review. Bottom line, the guest room bathrooms seemed incongruous to the design of the actual guest room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service - a truly elegant place”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay here for years and was somewhat worried that this hotel property was past its prime. My worries were unfounded because every aspect of our stay was glorious. The valet staff is the most efficient and professional that I have ever seen. The desk staff and concierge were welcoming, professional and accommodating. There was fruit, cookies and hot cider at the front entrance and a warm fire to enjoy in the lobby. We spent a lot of time in the cozy hotel bar and we received outstanding service. We even spent New Yearâ€™s Eve there and were impressed by the way the bartenders and servers handled the large crowd. Our room was very nice and I will say one negative thing â€“ the bathroom is in severe need of updating. That being said, it was large with double sinks, large soaking tub and an old school showerhead with plenty of water pressure â€“ nice! This hotel is located close to downtown with all it has to offer, Highland Park and Oak Lawn and their unique shopping areas, and some of the best restaurants in Dallas. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant during our stay, but we did order room service - the best burger that I have ever had and very nicely presented. We cannot wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “News Year Day Brunch 2012”
Reviews.Author: MRJMV
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to go to the Mansion Hotel to their resturant. I live here in wonderful Dalls Texas as a transplant from Caslifornia. I made my reservation. What a delightful experience we all had. From the beautifully appointed dining room.... we ate in the garden veranda. Such elegance from the service to the delicious food choices. Thjis was a special dining experince with friends that we will savor. We will definately return to the Mansion's dining room again. Afterwards we had a glass of champaigne in their beautiful bar. Check out the different rooms that were once the "Mansion" and now become the elegant rooms to the public to enjoy. Everyone looks good in these surroundings it's the coloration of the hotel's spaces and interior decor. Thank You for a lovely afternoon. JMV Dallas TX.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and lack of interest from the staff to address problems”
Reviews.Author: TexasMia
Reviews.Content: Would not return to this hotel . Old shower design required you to get in the shower to turn it on and no hot water available for 10 minutes. Staff said that we would just have to wait for the water to heat up . No apologies were given. Just that "it was an older building" . We have never had to wait for hot water. Went to Happy Hour and the house wine was $17.00 dollars A GLASS!! A dog across the hall started barking at 7:00 am when the owners went to breakfast. Finally enough people complained to the front desk that they took the dog downstairs. We will not be returning to this over rated Dallas landmark... .

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: michelle c
Reviews.Content: Words can't express how wonderful the complete experience was. The value was our greatest reward, which is saying a lot because the staff were amazing. I felt as if the way we were treated there was as all people should treat one another. Heavenly. Respectful, courteous, caring, attentive, and qualified. The staff was prepared and delivered exceptional service. It was my wedding weekend, and I saved precious time as they assisted in letter printing and delivery to some of our most special guests, picking up selections at Nieman's for me at the last minute, and the Chef made the most delicious caviar and oyster treat for my wedding party. I can't wait to try their Rosewood Crescent Hotel next. We will treat ourselves to their spa experiences and soak in the service they provide so well at The Rosewood property. All I can really say is "Heavenly to all the senses."

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Luxury and Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: TripTex
Reviews.Content: We atttended a party in Dallas and a friend recommended the Mansion on Turtle Creek. The biggest disappointment with staying here was it only involved a single night; too bad for us. The Mansion is a very inviting property and you leave yearning for a return visit. The room was spacious and nicely appointed with a functional working desk and a sofa and sitting area. Our room was light and airy with french doors overlooking the courtyard pool. The only bit of criticism is the size of the bathroom. Although the bathroom was nice enough, it was a tad bit on the small side. My wife ordered room service and she remarked to me how wonderful the food tasted.

Reviews.Title: “people make the difference”
Reviews.Author: ektlaw
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas on business and stayed here for two nights. It is a very welcoming place from the minute you drive up. The valet parking staff is a full on welcoming committee. I had a suite which was very well appointed with very very comfortable beds. The food here is excellent. I had dinner in my suite and the food was fantastic. I particularly recommend the braised beef rib. Everyone who works at the hotel is very friendly and extremely personable. I also like the fact that they put very tasteful reusable vials for shampoo in the bathrooms as opposed to the disposable toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star?”
Reviews.Author: jtchapman
Reviews.Content: Touted as the ONLY 5-Star and AAA 5-Diamond Hotel in Dallas, Texas, I would have to agree. The service and attention to detail deserves those accolades. We have stayed in many fine hotels, but the Mansion on Turtle Creek rates at the top. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out, EVERYONE knew MY name and made us welcome with Southern hospitaliy. A Lincoln Town car was at our disposal to take us to any venue within 5 miles of the hotel. We stayed here with our daughter and son in law for our annual Christmas trip. Best Christmas trip ever despite the foul weather.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow81
Reviews.Content: The service is what sets a five star hotel apart and Rosewood Mansion does not disappoint. The rooms are large and tastefully decorated. The bed is amazing, the linens silky, the towels huge and fluffy, the complimentary toiletries placed in tasteful glass dispensers not little plastic travel sizes, the room includes a vanity area with a lighted, magnified makeup mirror. But the service is truly special. The bellman spent fifteen minutes with us, showing us how to use the various services in the room and around the property, standing with us on the balcony and pointing out the sites, making sure our ice bucket was full. The turn down service (while we were dining) included muting of the lights, soft music from the Bose wave radio and a tray with complimentary slippers as well as having the robes laid out. The waiter in the restaurant took time to answer all my questions about the hotel's history and fetched a printed one for me to read. The concierge provided great directions and traffic advice. Nothing I wanted was treated as any trouble at all. Worthy of its ratings and reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Thankful for a great Thanksgiving!”
Reviews.Author: ihatefakenames
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious and welcoming. The bed is the most comfortable bed I've found in ages. Figuring out how to work the TV was a challenge, but the IPod extras were great! We were there for 4 days and every day the staff was amazing! I've never had such great service! Wonderful little touches like hot apple cider and fresh baked cookies waiting for you in the lobby on a really cold afternoon. Room service had a perfectly cooked cheeseburger to us at 1:00 am after checkin within 15 minutes of our request. Dinner in the main dining room is always delicious, but we had the perfect small room for our family Thanksgiving dinner that allowed us to feel like we had the family time you miss not having this meal at home. Rom service was always prompt and delicious. I love their Eggs Benedict! The whole experience was wonderful, and what made it that way especially was superb staff in every position.

Reviews.Title: “My happy place!”
Reviews.Author: jackcameback
Reviews.Content: Just just returned from a hastily planned weeknight stay at the Mansion on Turtle Creek. Service and hospitality from the moment we stepped out of our car upon arrival until we pulled out to leave was as good as it gets. Our king room was very comfortable and well apportioned. We enjoyed drinks in the bar followed by dinner, and and our experience was truly first rate. Our waiter at dinner stated he has been serving in the restaurant for thirteen years. The meal was fabulous and service was as well. I have dubbed the Mansion my "happy place" and hope to return for another stay very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in the south mabey the country”
Reviews.Author: Ben201
Reviews.Content: I stay in 5 star hotel at least 10. Nights a month and this is my favorite! The terrace suite is amazing. Pricy at $2000 a night but amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Magic at The Mansion”
Reviews.Author: Maribeth
Reviews.Content: My daughter really loves life as a freshman at SMU. And her parents are grateful that there are two Rosewood properties within minutes of the campus. Never did we think a Parents' Weekend could be such a wonderful retreat for those footing the tuition bill! When we speak to other families about SMU, Rosewood is always a part of the conversation. After 5 wonderful visits at The Crescent in Uptown, I decided to investigate The Mansion, for a girls' weekend with my sister and my daughter. Mara's professionalism and interest in our party, when I called with a pre-arrival request, were very impressive and set the tone for a remarkable experience. From Thomas' warm introduction to the hotel, as we walked the hallways to our room....to Oriana's unexpected proclamation when we called for breakfast service the next morning, sharing a dietary restriction, "The hotel has gluten-free bread and we can make you toast!" .....to Jackson's prompt and fun room service deliveries, which included ice packs for an injury, unsolicited but oh so appreciated...I felt like we had stepped in to a fairy tale....and I was one of the three princesses. Becky suggested and arranged an amazing Sunday afternoon snack on the restaurant's terrace and Haley served our delicious treats (grit fries...really?!?!) patiently and sweetly, as we basked in the perfection that is The Mansion. The hotel is beautiful, but there are many, many spectacular properties around the world. What sets The Mansion on Turtle Creek apart is its commitment to impeccable service from dawn until dark, offered in an unaffected and genuine way. Very few establishments get it right....that perfect blend of being there for you, but not being intrusive. They do. I can't wait to take my husband for a weekend and enjoy the wine list and restaurant ....and more time on the terrace, under the trees by the fireplace. There's a special kind of magic being made at The Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: Felicia M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosewood Mansion for 1 night and I must say it was one of the most enjoyable experinces that I have had. We chose the Sweetheart package for our 13th Anniversary and everything was taken care for us. The staff was warm and very friendly from the start. We were greeted by name the second we arrived by every person that we came in contact with and told Happy Anniversary by all. The rose turndown of our bed and the aromatherapy bath was just beautiful. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone.....first class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “I have died and gone to heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Gary P
Reviews.Content: I was really hard to leave this wonderful hotel! The service was impeccable. After arriving, they sent a waiter to our room with a delicious apricot tart and passion fruit iced tea. They have a Lincoln Town car available to take you around town. It was nice having a ride home after dinner and not having to worry about how much wine we had. The Hostess at the restaurant gave us a tour of the mansion and told us about the history. Everytime we left our room, they cleaned it and left fresh towels. It was so quiet - we never heard other guests when we were in our room. Stay here if you are in Dallas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Service We've had in Years”
Reviews.Author: Eiregirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosewood Mansion for two days. The location is great and the room was lovely -- but it was the fantastic service that really set this hotel apart. The service from the 'front of the house' team was absolutely stellar. Everyone we encountered was friendly and accommodating and there were a number of small touches (a follow-up note from the concierge, a cup of coffee that materialized during check-out, advice from the doorman, etc.) that really took our experience to another level. The housekeeping service was also a stand-out and you could tell that a lot of thought had been put into the room amenities. Water bottles on each side of the bed during turn-down service doesn't sound like a big deal, but I'm surprised by how many high-end hotels miss the opportunity for these kind of low-cost (but thoughtful) personal touches. Rosewood didn't miss a beat in this area. We also had dinner at the Mansion Restaurant and...wow The service here was even more extraordinary than the food, and that's saying something. The Chef's Tasting Menu was superb. We've been lucky enough to stay in some posh hotels over the last few years, but this is one of the first times that I thought the experience was completely on par with the price. We won't hesitate to return to this hotel, and we'll definitely be checking out other Rosewood locations the next time we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimDJohnsonIII
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well appointed and staff friendly yet quite professional. The Mansion at Turtle Creek is in a beautiful part of Dallas and the hotel itself quite historical. All in all, a very nice and comfortable visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: JWSPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: This is a magnificent, well-appointed hotel in a great location. The staff is amazingly warm, kind, and attentive, in a truly friendly way. They don't hover but you feel like they are there for you and anytime I asked a question the staff member was so helpful. Our room was HUGE and had beautiful furnishings, comfortable bed, pillows, high-end bedding, great Bose radio, very clean, so quiet it was hard to believe there were others in the hotel. From room service to getting our car from the garage, everything was so fast and efficient. I didn't open a car door during our entire stay! The food is delicious, the restaurant, whether inside or outside, lovely. The bar was great with music on Friday night. I only wish we could have stayed more than three nights. We were there with our 6-year-old daughter and she was also made to feel so special, starting with the stuffed turtle she was given when we checked in to the cupcakes and milk waiting in our room! Can't wait to return. Love, love, love Rosewood Mansin.

Reviews.Title: “BIG 60!!”
Reviews.Author: Secondhandgirl
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel!! Was a wonderful way to elegantly celebrate a Big b'day! Staff acknowledged at both breakfast and dinner in a quiet manner with a special serving plate decorated with "Happy Birthday". No tacky singing or candles, just pure class!!!! My husband and I loved it and if ever back in area this is THE only place to stay. Congratulations to all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stays each visit”
Reviews.Author: tootlepops
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mansion four times, and each time was wonderful. From the time that you enter the lobby the service is attentive and accomodating. I usually stayed after appointments all day so returning to such lovely accomodations was a welcome respite. The food was always wonderful, concierge extremely helpful with great recommendations, and the rooms were luxuriously appointed. The room was always very quiet as well...which is a huge plus for me. If I am going downtown Dallas, this is my favorite place to stay. You cannot beat the the quaint atmosphere of feeling like your staying in someone's home and the courteous service.

Reviews.Title: “Mansion Living”
Reviews.Author: ablink
Reviews.Content: I spent two perfect evenings at the Mansion in September. If there is such a thing as a perfect hotel stay, this would qualify. The concierge desk is devoted to making everything happen that you want. A cupcake on my nightstand.......ice in the ice bucket........super clean and quiet....linens that are superb.......a setting that is beyond compare for urban......any negative reviews about this place must be by some very special people........I just couldn't find fault......yest, things are expensive.......but this ain't the Hampton Inn, baby!

Reviews.Title: “Dinner and Stay at the Mansion”
Reviews.Author: brian p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just celebrated our first anniversary by haviing dinner and staying overnight at the Mansion on Turtle Creek. From the time we pulled into the Valet we were treated with warm hospitality. Our arrival at the front desk was friendly, professional, and efficient. We were escorted to our room and were suprised how big the room actually was. We stay at many historic hotels, and the Mansion's rooms are a treat. Not to mention, the room was impeccably clean. We walked down to the bar to enjoy the atmosphere before dinner and ordered a couple of cocktails, both of which were classic cocktails done right. The bar had a warm feel and was busy but not crowded. Great asmophere. Dinner was outstanding. Lobster risotto and crispy sweetbreads to start. Cooked to perfection. Second was the chef's take on shrimp cocktail. The dish was extremely fresh and the shrimp were not overcooked. For entrees my wife had the duck prepared two ways (breast and confit) and I had the grilled venison. Neither disappointed and again were cooked to perfection. Finally, save room for dessert. The pastry chef creates delicious works of art. We couldn't have asked for a better anniversary treat, and I hope we can make it a tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: ec1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights for our first Parents' Weekend at SMU. Fantastic experience. Superb and friendly service. I love how the valet said "Welcome Home!" every time we came back to the hotel. Had a lovely lunch on the terrace (outstanding food) and breakfast, room service, came precisely at the 7 a.m. requested time all three mornings. I am a clock-watcher and I noticed that the rap on the door each morning was precisely at 7. Impressed! Location is great - walking in the morning is fun. Great workout facility. Pretty pool, although we did not use it. My only suggestion is that we were surprised the bathroom had no "amenities" such as a bottle of lotion or make up remover or q-tips, something that is common at all nice hotels. There were large bottles of shampoo and conditioner in the shower, something I suppose that is used from guest to guest. Staff is professional and friendly. This will be our home away from home for the next four years!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mymannick
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at this hotel. Excellent service from arrival,everybody well trained in customer service,from bellmen to housekeeping. Great location, and food quality of the highest level. The rooms were very comfortable in all aspects,except bathrooms are in urgent need of updating, all polished brass finishes and the brass is rubbed off already. Would have expected better bathrooms for five star rating. Boutiquey feel and concierge outstanding, especially mary and ashley. Definately would go back and better if bathrooms are updated. Good rates would have preferred a resort fee and free wifi like comparable properties. House car service was very helpful and bell service outstanding. More a couples or business hotel than family. Also a coffe maker not available, this level hotel should have a nestle or keurig capsule coffee maker in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly stay at a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: xiphe
Reviews.Content: We can find only very minor faults with our recent weekend stay in Dallas. Check in with Anna could not have been better; she was friendly, appropriately conversational, and confirmed an upgrade. The valet and bellhop immediately assisted us upon our arrival and spent time orienting us to the room. Valet consistently had our car quickly available with a call. The attention to detail in the design of the property was excellent and definitely sets it apart. I greatly enjoyed the art. On arrival, we received a welcome amenity consisting of a small 3 inch cake and a small carafe of ice tea which we split, which seemed a little meager but was appreciated. The room was very quiet and comfortable, with a very restful design. There was LOADS of storage space. The bathroom was a little dated, but well maintained. The towels were excellent, and the shower temp and water pressure were excellent as well. The toiletries were a little too feminine in their fragrance. The bed/linens were top notch; we found ourselves taking naps during the day, which we almost never do. Breakfast at the restaurant was very tasty, with over the top level of staffing. Pricey, but that is not surprise. Makes for a nice treat. I look forward to returning; it will feel like visiting friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hobo in the Palace ....”
Reviews.Author: Portenos_at_Heart
Reviews.Content: Nice! What can you say but the service was excellent, everyone was super-friendly, and don't miss the cocktail show from the Rosewood Mansion bar seat. Think clubby decor and heritage drinks from the 1930s and â€™40s. Food was a bit steep in price but worth every expensive, precious little bite, especially the mini burgers, smoked short rib tacos, and ceviche. Definitely would return as this felt like 'home' even if we were not as dressed up as our Mansion cohorts. Tip: Go to the Mansion bar at happy hour and have the bartender make you one of his custom liquid specials. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week as we visited SMU. The Mansion sets the bar from perfect service and relaxation. Will stay again, Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Flawless customer service, beautiful decor, excellent restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: CorrePolloRenco
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and include pleasant amenities. Slept well in the bed. Front desk and concierge were superb, accommodating all requests. Restaurant was very good as well, and the bar has a great feel to it. The hotel shuttle takes guests to distances up to 5 miles, so it's quite useful. Cons- The gym are was undergoing some renovations, so I didn't go. The pool is small. Not a lot going on around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service”
Reviews.Author: LJOceanGrl
Reviews.Content: Lovely historic hotel with charm. The staff were friendly and attentive. Great bar with excellent bar tenders. Everything you would expect from a Rosewood hotel! Glad we chose this for our non-business visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but needs some competition!”
Reviews.Author: SydneySydney66
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel staffed by truly excellent people that provide premium quality service. The rooms are attractive and well maintained if a little conservative for my own taste. The location, between Dallas downtown and the prestigious northern residential areas and close to freeways, is very good. However, the hotel could do with some competition to bring it completely up to scratch - some examples are no coffee maker in room (surely a standard nowadays) requiring expensive room service coffee. The room service menu is tiny (quite surprising given the famous in-house restaurant) and the prices truly absurd, even by five star hotel standard. The public areas and bathrooms in the bedrooms are beautifully maintained but in a more competitive market would have been redesigned years ago. You'd say the hotel was a little complacent, if the people weren't so good. But anyway, bring on the competition!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: slatercreek
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there many times in the past, but the place has steadily gone downhill for several years. Last week, the room was worn down, not very clean; the air conditioning was totally inadequate (in Dallas!). The place is even more over-priced than ever. The food is very unremarkable. The pool area is shockingly bad. It is not a great hotel, as it was in the past. Give it a pass!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: lujacque
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you just hit the jackpot. The Mansion on Turtle Creek is the jack pot. We traveled with my 3 month old baby for our first overnight stay. The accomodations were amazing. It makes you never want to stay at another property. We stayed in adjoining suites. It was amazing. The sleep was wonderful. The hotel security was also wonderful. I locked myself out of my room early one morning while my family was sleeping and security escorted me back to my room. They were very aware of who their guests were and where they were staying. If someone had been out of place they would have know immediately. It would not go unnoticed. Our rooms came with a continental breakfast but because the baby fell asleep during breakfast time they delivered it to the room room service style. Everyone was very helpful and very service minded. I will stay here any opportunity I have. It was my birthday weekend and was such a relaxing get away.

Reviews.Title: “A surprising disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gaslamplover
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dallas for business and did a lot of research on different hotels. The Rosewood Mansion on Turtle Creek seemed like it would be the perfect blend of southern charm and five star luxury. When I checked into the hotel, I was given keys to a room that was dark, smelled musty, and overlooked the hotel's main air conditioning unit. What a disappointment! I immediately went back to the front desk and asked for a room change, which was accomodated, but the first room given left a very bad taste in my mouth. With a five star hotel you expect every room to be nice and to have a special feel--especially if you are staying for three days! As Dallas was over 100 degrees, I decided to go for a dip after my last afternoon meeting and the pool was postage stamp size. Perhaps 7 people could comfortably fit into the bath water temperature water. The bar is special and certaintly worth visiting, but I would recommend the Ritz Carlton in Dallas over the Rosewood Mansion if you are looking for a high end stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service, but overpriced room service”
Reviews.Author: stampwife
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the site of a business meeting, and it is a lovely place to stay. My room was large and very well designed/appointed. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the shower excellent (the two most important parts of a hotel room). I had one of the first floor rooms with an outdoor patio that was large and very private. Hotel employees were gracious and very accommodating. I didn't eat in the restaurant but the food we had at the meeting was very good. A few quibbles: 1) no in room coffee, although it was available in the lobby 2) room service was prompt but way overpriced and not very good 3) if I were this property I wouldn't advertise the Turtle Creek part. I went for a walk and found it very disappointing. There is a real creek but it is next to a busy thoroughfare and there was rubbish in the trees and on the banks.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: cigarman99
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever had the pleasure to stay at. The spacious rooms have a truly elegant, yet homey feel. Awesome bedding. Great cuisine. Staff was very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Escape”
Reviews.Author: gwcala
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to Dallas with 2 small dogs and were joined by two other friends for a Christmas escape at the Mansion. Accommodations, service, food and beverage could not have been better. When traveling with pets, request a "patio room" on the first floor. The guest room opens onto a private walled and landscaped patio with a bistro table and 2 chairs. The hotel staff is without peer.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing girls' weekend”
Reviews.Author: TXPhD11
Reviews.Content: I'm originally from Dallas, so have experienced The Mansion many times over the years. This last time I was about to leave the country for work for 5 months, and stayed for a girls' weekend with my best friend. We were met with welcoming grace and friendliness which is the true Texas spirit sometimes absent from people in Dallas. The valet was friendly as was our bellhop who showed us to our room and showed us all the features. We were upgraded to a suite with an additional bathroom and living area which is something I always appreciate--if the better room is just sitting there empty, why not give an upgrade? My friend and i enjoyed all day out by the pool with some of the greatest margaritas I've had in a long time. We then met other friends for dinner and wine at the bar while enjoying live entertainment but unfortunately was not my favorite Mansion entertainer, Hunter Sullivan. Just going to one of Hunter's shows is worth a stay at the Mansion if you are into the old charm of Sinatra days. He's not a cheesey Sinatra impersonator but a talented charmer himself. The dishes are great. If you just want to have cocktails or wine while watching the show there are great snacks such as my favorite truffle fries or an amazing foie gras. I've had dinner here too which has never disappointed. And the wine list is extensive, a book, and the sommelier is great as well, making wonderful choices each time I've described what I'd like--I had an amazing white Chateauneuf du Pape here last year that I can't forget! Amazing all around, with friendly staff, the Mansion remains one of my favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointment !!”
Reviews.Author: Barb11200
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to be staying at this hotel. We were in Dallas to visit our son and decided to treat ourselves. The staff was friendly upon arrival, but things quickly deteriorated. We were told that we would be recieving automatic room service with a welcoming tray and ice (had to call for ice whenever needed). The room service never happened. I went to bed the first night and thought the bed was very uncomfortable. In the morning i discovered that the mattress wasn't in the frame on the one side. Also, at 5:00 am, the alarm went off VERY loudly. It was on a Spanish speaking station. At 5:30 am alarm #2 went off. As you can imagine, my first night's sleep was miserable. I shared this with the front desk clerk and recieved a simple " I am so sorry maam." Never heard another word. I also filled out a survey that the hotel sent via email, and never got any response. I truly feel that they do not care. We had breakfast there, very pricey, and my husband didn't eat his. It truly wasn't very good. Next time, back to either the Adolphus or the Crescent, both very satisfying experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anny020
Reviews.Content: The Rosewood offered the best service i have ever received, even stretching to getting us the best table at a retaurant and buying us canapes to make our trip even more enjoyable. The bed was huge and possibly the most comfortable i have ever stayed in, the private car was fabulous taking you free of charge around the dallas area. All in all a fabulous hotel, with attentive and dedicated staff, a definate must stay if your in Dallas!!

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: WanderingXpat
Reviews.Content: Quiet and refined luxury - outstanding rooms, superb food, charming and helpful staff. The location is slightly off the beaten track, but that keeps the noise down. Outdoor breakfast a highlight. Absolutely the best final stop on a US business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Resturant Is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mdaltonTX
Reviews.Content: You have to go to the Resturant if in Dallas... amazing menu and wonderful from start to finish! Rosewood Mansion and Rosewood Cresent are both fabulous hotels in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay for 2 nights at the end of August, a Saturday and Sunday. Valet and check-in were courteous and efficient. The (upgraded) room was spotless and well presented, as you would expect. The decor not really to my taste, but nicely done. On the Saturday, the bar and restaurant were packed to capacity, but a nice buzz. Much quieter on the Sunday of course. Overall comment on the restaurant would be that the space itself is comfortable enough, nothing special. Food on the Saturday was presented stone cold. It was rectified, but who let the plate go? Sunday was much better, possibly due to less pressure on the kitchen. Not being a fan of Dean Fearings restaurant or food, I would say this looks like a step up. There is a small pool area which is quite private and secluded - except for aircraft directly overhead every couple of minutes. I gave up after about half an hour. In short, a pleasant stay and a great alternative to the factory hotel chains in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cinnam0n
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a night at the Mansion just for a quick getaway. Having read the reviews, I was expecting a lot and was not disappointed! Service is impeccable, the hotel is clean and decorated nicely. I enjoyed the pool area, it is small, but is clean and well maintained. The room and bathroom were also very nice. The only odd occurrence was while we were getting ready for dinner (and I was not fully dressed!) we recieved a knock on the door, before we even realized it, the doorknob was turning. I quickly yelled "we're still in here!" but the person continued in anyway and having nowhere to go, I actually hid myself behind the drapes! Luckily my husband intercepted the person in the hallway so I didn't flash anyone but it was absolutely horrifying. I was annoyed that the person kept coming in even though we shouted that we were still in the room, but since he was delivering a hand written note and a delicious pastry from the manager I got over it...Anyway, lesson learned! Always lock the chain lock when you're in the room!

Reviews.Title: “I had the pleasure of staying at the...”
Reviews.Author: Chriskink
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Mansion on Turtle creek this august and to my suprise it was during restaurant week. I managed to get a reservation in the very well remodeled new dinning room, luxury and service everywhere the room was alive with excitement. We had the three course menu with an amazing water melon salad and a slightly less amazing squash soup. Main course was a crawfish stuffed chicken thigh accompanied by a warm salad of potatos spinach and tomato and the sauce.. to die for. She had a corn and spinach ravioli on a crawfish red sauce, which tasted 100% better then it sounds. Deserts were equally impressive and of all the restaurant week establishments I've been, this is my top choice. I will certainly be coming back for dinner. As for the chef Bruno Davaillon, love the accent, he couldn't be a nicer gentlemen. We thank the Mansion for making this night unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Very gracious and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Boombafam
Reviews.Content: Took a trip with a college friend after we graduated to escape ''real life'' and all the responsibilities of being an adult! We had a fun girls' weekend shopping at Neimans and riding around in the hotel's limo. The staff was really nice about offering places to go for dinner and tourism. I think they were more used to older people or families, but they still helped a lot with navigating an unfamiliar city. The car service was SOOO helpful! The trip was pricey but they pampered you well.

Reviews.Title: “The Mansion: As good as everyone says!”
Reviews.Author: stjoesun
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Dallas, we opted to stay at The Mansion on Turtle Creek so that our stay would be more relaxing and enjoyable. In fact, it was. I believe that they are considered to be a special place because of their extremely discreet and personalized service. Although we had some mix ups at the restaurant (which they compensated for), the hotel experience was spot-on. I cannot say eenough about it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay.”
Reviews.Author: PVBfla
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. Everything was grand. Service was exceptional and I would highly recomend this property. I was not a fan of the restaurant, but that did not take away from a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 week roadtrip through Texas. We stopped in Dallas and stayed 2 nights at the Mansion and loved, loved, loved it!! We've stayed at many 5 star hotels before and this one is the best. The staff were wonderful and made you feel special. The minute we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by the valet and helped us with our luggage and many shopping bags lol...check in was fast and friendly...the room was immaculate, clean and spacious...the room service was excellent...front desk staff were helpful..the hotel had a real Dallas feel (very historic and beautiful) There were 2 employees in particular that we want to commend...when we arrived Sala immediately made us feel welcomed and greeted us everytime he saw us during our stay. We always stopped to talk to him and shared stories...one evening when we returned back to the hotel from dinner he gave us a history lesson about the hotel which we found very interesting. He told us that he was planning to visit Toronto (that's where we're from) and Niagara Falls this summer...we hope he has a good trip. Mary on the concierge desk was also so nice. She gave us directions to JFK museum, Northpark shopping mall and made arrangements for us to have the house car driver take us to dinner at 560 Wolfgang Puck's at Reunion Tower that night. The house car driver (sorry forgot his name) was also very friendly. We can't say enough about the staff at the Mansion. We are already planning a return trip back to Dallas next year and we will definately stay at the Mansion again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CITY HOTEL IN DALLAS”
Reviews.Author: PETER46Belgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as a stopover. All the positive of the other reviewers is correct. What was negative to our opinion. Airco is very noisy and turning it off during the night was not on option. Room was very warm all time. Opening the window at night was not a good idea neither due to the heavy noise of all the surrounding aircos on the roofs of the other buildings Breakfast a la carte is very expensive ( 70 to 100 dollar for two persons!) OK i want to pay this amount for a lavish buffet with lot's of choise but this wasn't the case. Pool is quite small and pool area is also quite noisy of all the surrounding airco's and vans who deliver at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Resturant Review Only”
Reviews.Author: lex33333
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I love a good meal. The food was .... great if there was enough of it to fill you up. They give super small portions! We ordered a 3 course dinner and we were both still hungry and I don't eat much. Pros: 1) They greeted us well and gave us a booth that we could sit on the same side. 2) They gave us a personalized congrats card for our anniversary. 3) The wine menu was extensive. 4) Valet was fast and the patio was nice. Cons: 1) The waitress insulted me twice. I have never heard of a martini on ice and my date had a steak knife for his steak, but I was given a butter knife for my lamb. I asked for a steak knife as well and she mentioned how neither of those things are normal and she had worked there for a long time. I've eaten at a lot of nice restaurants and those were both new to me, which shouldnâ€™t have been brought to my attention. 2) The portions were too small, 6 bites in a large dessert and 2 bites of short rib. I mean small! 3) We weren't asked how our food was after we were served our entrees. She didn't check if the steak was cooked properly, which it wasn't. 3) The menu was not explained. She pointed out the $95 meal and that was all. 4) Service was really slow. It took us 45 mins for our appetizer, another 30 for our entree, 20 for our dessert, and 30 minutes to get our tab. 5) When we called, they said they didn't have an open reservation, but they made and exception and accommodated us. Which would be a good thing, however, when we got there the dining room was only 60% full at 8:00 and slowly decreased from there. I would say the service was 2.5 stars, the food was 3.5 stars if there was enough to eat and overall experience was a 3. The cheesecake dessert was the highlight of my meal, but 6 bites isn't worth the drive. I think we are going to stick with Eddie V's, Sambuca's, Into the Glass, Ovations, The Vault, etc. None of which are five star restaurants, but have better food, bigger portions and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is wonderful. Dinner in their restaurant was comparable to the higher end NY restaurants. The room was large, with a large bathroom and was furnished well. My lower rating for the room reflects little things - musty smell, my room overlooked a parking lot, bathroom although redone has some flaws - tub is old and so are the fixtures, and some of the tiling/wallpapering is not done well. Overall happy with my stay for what I needed, and would come back mainly because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Mansion on Turtle Creek-Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: JanisSpokane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our anniversary trip to Texas. I booked a package through the internet that was called, I believe, A Taste of the Mansion. It was a great package though that is not why we selected the hotel-I had always wanted to stay there then to add frosting to the cake they added a free night since we choose to stay 3 nights instead of 2. Before we even arrived I was constantly impressed with the numerous contact emails and calls they made verifying our needs and asking if we had any further requests. I have worked in hotels most of my career and traveled around the world and was amazed at the level of service, caring, warmth and hospitality. We arrived to a polite but very friendly reception from the valet and then found hot cider, apples and gorgeous fragrant flowers in the lobby. The front desk associate was delightful and there was an anniversary card greeting waiting for us from the manager. We were taken to our room where there were iced tea, chocolate covered strawberries and another card waiting in our room , again courtesy of the manager. What a great start to our stay and it only got better. We then went to the lounge for cocktails which were included in our package. It was a very classy upscale lounge, but not stuffy, and full of beautiful Texans (you could just tell). Obviously this is a popular spot for locals too. We then went to dinner in the dining room. Our reservation was handled beautifully and we were seated immediately. We sat in the atrium part which was lovely because it was actually snowing outside (it had been 75 the day before). Just beautiful and very romantic! In retrospect of the great service I wouldn't be surprised if the manager hadn't ordered the snow just to add to the ambiance. The service was fantastic and the food was delicious. We thought we would get a special menu because of the package but were able to order anything we wanted off the regular menu. The only thing not included was caviar. Oh, I forgot to mention the chef and the restaurant manager also welcomed us with anniversary cards when we arrived. What attention to detail!! The next morning we ordered the package breakfast from room service and again were allowed to order whatever we wanted. This was one package where they really wanted you to enjoy what they had to offer and not make you feel like you were being given a deal or made it difficult to use like most hotels do (listen up Las Vegas). Each day the valets were a delight (one night's parking fee was included in the package too) and constantly offered us cold chilled bottles of water (no $6.00 bottle of water gimmick-don't hotels realize how insulting that is?) and gave us great service and great directions. As we were leaving on our last day I was carrying two bottles of warm water that we hadn't used. The valet took them from me and exchanged them for cold ones without my even asking him. Wow! Oh, by the way, not to be totally overshadowed by the fantastic service, the Mansion itself is incredibly beautiful and recently remodeled. The beds and pillows were fabulous and the bathroom and amenities incredible. It was fun to read about the history of the mansion as it was a cotton barons home at one time. However, do not get the impression that it is some type of elegant old B& B type. It is a very up to date 5* hotel of incredible warmth and beauty in a great location with a well earned reputation for excellence. Another example, I had asked for a steamer and they very nicely put a full size professional steamer in the room and left it for the whole stay. Room was spotless and faultless. As you can see I would highly recommend staying at the Mansion when you are in Dallas. I have only been to one hotel I could compare it to (and we never stay in less than a 4* hotels) and that would be The Alvear Palace in Buenos Aires. Whoever is doing the training for this hotel sure knows what they are doing and the manager is to be highly commended for developing such a fabulous team and product. We stayed in a Four Seasons in Austin after we left Dallas and as great as they were they had a hard time competing after our stay at The Mansion. Janis Ilenstine .

Reviews.Title: “Premium Quality at a very attractive price point”
Reviews.Author: SolidGround
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and onsite dining. Gorgeous rooms, beautiful hotel, helpful staff, tasty complimentary Italian candy and the best part of all was the bill. A place like this is twice the money in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luxury Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: emmjaypee
Reviews.Content: I love the Mansion. I came back to it after many years and it got even better.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kcoffin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mansion before and been pleased, but in January 2010, I booked a room for my child and myself while we were on a short visit to Dallas for her Birthday. The lobby was under construction, (which was not mentioned when I made my reservation) so we entered through a ground floor guest room with a makeshift reception desk. The feel of the hotel is decidedly different when you enter as if you are coming in the back door. The only request for special service that I made in advance of our stay was that they say, "Happy Birthday," to my 8 year old daughter and make her feel special. In fact, no one mentioned her Birthday at all unless I prompted them, and even then there was no enthusiasm or sincerity. We were put in a room overlooking the parking lot of the building next door...a really terrible view. The newly remodeled rooms seemed unremarkable. The coffee table and desk were unsubstantial. The room service dinner was very costly (as one would expect) but was very disappointing, especially considering a new chef and menu. I asked them to adjust their "macaroni and cheese" dish to make it simple for my child's tastes, but they did not make any adjustments that I could discern. We had to go out for pizza. After my stay, the Mansion sent an email request for an evaluation. I filled in the evaluation honestly and got no response at all. This really surprised me. I must say, though, that the valet service was quite good. Those men are very accommodating, super nice and were very kind to my daughter. Also, the beds were very comfortable and breakfast was good....but not good enough for the price at all. For the same price I could have stayed in a large suite at another, more central, more friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you are impressed by turn-down service, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: dianawales
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean; staff amenable. You basically feel you are held hostage, though. There is nothing around the hotel within walking distance; you either have to eat there or tip the valets to get your car out once again! By, the way, there is ONLY valet parking - 25 dollars a day. The restaurant room service menu offers "a half-chicken" for $26.00. By that,they meant one very meager chicken breast. We also ordered $8.00 sides - "jasmine rice" and "curried vegetables - eggplant, cauliflower,zucchini" . Each side was approximately 1/2 cup in size - the rice, just white rice - the vegetables, frozen - no curry flavor at all. Gordon Ramsay would have taken all the stars from this restaurant! It was really shameful! For that, along with the room service taxes, $60.00 for an inedible meal! There is a lot of faux kissing up, but no substance behind it! We stayed three nights, and could never watch a movie in the room because it didn't work. And every time it didn't work, we had to dress so a person could come fix it so we could just go back to regular telelvision. We travel regularly both domestically and abroad; pretty easy travelers. This hotel is rated far too high, in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: dgely
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night with 3 of our children. There is nothing negative to say. The staff was extremely nice, the rooms were pretty and clean and the restaurant was great. The lobby was very inviting and the fireplace was on 24 hours a day. When we arrived they sent up cookies and milk for the children. We checked out the pool and the fitness center. They both looked nice. The only negative was the view from our window was nothing to look at. If we visit Dallas again we would choose to stay here or the sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TarynfromHollywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a trip to Dallas for our friend's wedding. This hotel is right in the middle of the city, but it seems to be a world away. It's definitely not the best five-star I've ever stayed in though. The service was a little bit lacking. Everyone was friendly though for the most part. The rooms are very comfortable and inviting. I slept very well. All in all, very nice. (:

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: From the very first interaction with the valet/front desk upon arrival through the entire stay all of the staff were terrific, professional, friendly and a can do attitude. The hotel has a very warm welcoming feeling, my guestroom was spotless, very spacious, nice dÃ©cor. Housekeeping was excellent (folding clothes...) The gym has new equipment, sauna, steam and swimming pool. Breakfast was very good in a beautiful room, room service was also very good and again excellent service. The main lobby was closed for renovations however did not impact our stay. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: JBR29
Reviews.Content: The service was the best I've ever experienced. Overall, they did everything to make us feel comfortable and pampered. The room was amazingly comfortable, especially the bedding. If I had the money, I'd buy one for my home. The staff were helpful, prompt, and friendly. I popped a button off my shirt and called the front desk for a sewing kit. They brought it up to my room in under two minutes -- the needles were already threaded and everything. Just an example of how carefully they think about how to serve their guests. The only disclaimer is that I didn't pay for the room myself, so I don't know how much of a value the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: emmochka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first night of our honeymoon. Everything was perfect --the room, the food, the service, the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service - Property in need of major updates”
Reviews.Author: screwy
Reviews.Content: The Mansion is a historic gem in the heart of Dallas. My husband and I went for an overnight to celebrate our anniversary with a special rate of $199. The service is impeccable, from the valet to the front desk to the bar. We had a great time overall, but there are a few caveats. First, the hotel is in need of major updates. The rooms are a bit worn, with wallpaper peeling around the edges. The TV are old-school clunkers, the only music in the room is a CD player with no iPod docking, and there is no WIFI in the hotel. I think for the price and for the title of "luxury hotel", these are items are a must. It feels a little too old. The mattresses are not the plush Heavenly Beds you'll find at The Westin, the sheets were not the luxurious ones you'll find at a Four Seasons or W. The lighting in the dressing area were reminiscent of a top rate hotel in 1985. As I said, the service is stellar. The cocktail servers are great, but you'd expect that when paying $15 per drink. All in all, it was a lovely trip, but I'd wait to go back once they've updated the property.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, Serenity in the heart of Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: iloveloveseaotters
Reviews.Content: We came home to Dallas for a wedding and decided to stay at the Mansion instead of with family. It was the best decision that we could have made. After having lived in Dallas for 28 years, I had no idea that there was a place that was so serene and beautfiul. Had I known, I might have picked this location for my wedding. From the moment we drove up to the front door, we have been treated as though we were their only guests. Call down to the front desk for anything and within moments, someone arrives at your door. We asked where the ice machine was, and instead someone brought a silver bucket of ice to our room. We found some ants on the floor that had discovered some crumbs from a pastry that we had eaten, and someone came to sweep up the debris. We have been away from Dallas for so long that we have been having trouble with directions, so the hotel always makes sure that we know how to get around. I will say that if there are any flaws with this hotel, it's that it can be very tricky to find. It's in a residential neighborhood in Turtle Creek, but that's what makes it so wonderful. Since we have been here, we haven't heard a sound from the other guests. The spa is wonderful, with showers, steam room, lockers with robes and slippers. The pool area is nice; Small, but not so small that it's uncomfortable. Plus, it even comes with a waiter, who can take food orders. The pool isn't very deep; five feet at most, but it's very relaxing during the hot Dallas summers! The room is very spacious; we have a balcony that looks out onto the street, and the room has a DVD player. Downstairs behind the front desk, there is a business center that could be considered an office. Internet service in the business center is free 24/7, but you can also use the high speed in your room for $10 per day. That's a bargain, compared to some places. The hotel is small, but there is valet parking and the staff will retrieve your car within minutes of asking for it. We have decided that from now on, every time we come to Dallas, we are staying at The Mansion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a five star experience”
Reviews.Author: wld50Toronto
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Mansion, we were very impressed with the greeting we received from staff including the Front door, Check-in Service and Concierge. After that, the service was poor to average. It was definately not five star service in the restaurant or the patio, where we had long waits to receive drinks. The staff were not educated on the offerings of specials or cocktails. We had to ask for a menu at the restaurant! At the Pool, guests are required to phone for water , bar or food service and are charged a room service fee for anything ordered. We had to skim bugs out of the Spa Tub and fill it with water ourselves so that it was full enough to turn on. In our rooms, we had to order ice from room service. We completed guest surveys and have yet to hear back from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way - they really made our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: knomad
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. We've stayed in many 5 stars the world over, and we honestly think this is probably the best experience we've ever had. We showed up in a beaten up old airport van with all of our snowboarding luggage, and they were even nicer to us than those guests stepping out of their Ferraris! They made our honeymoon so special - hand written notes, chocolates and champagne, stored luggage for 3 weeks, every staff member knew our name, we had monogrammed pillow-slips and they bent over backwards to help us get around Dallas and see the sights. The food is brilliant - both the restaurant, and the room service (my husband declared this the best room service burger he's ever had). The bar is lots of fun, great cocktails. When we returned at the end of January we were able to use the intimate little pool due to a hot spell. Fabulous. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely respite in middle of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Openstudio
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel strictly from the internet and online reviews and were not disappointed. It is very reminiscant of the Valencia Hotel in San Diego. It is a bit tired in some areas but the bones are there. The restaurant food is top notch as is the service. The overall atmosphere is very friendly. They aim to please and do so. The bathrooms were nice and the shower was very strong. The exercise room is fully equipped and the pool is small but adequate. It is only 5 feet deep on the deep end so not for some swimmers. It takes about 5 or 6 strokes to get across the long end. The hotel upgraded us without asking to the Presidential suite and it was very large and perfect for entertaining our family and friends. The only little thing we didn't like was that there was a full kitchen without any dishes or silverware. They gave us a little pie upon arrival but we had to order room service to get something to eat it with. Also it would have been nice to have some sort of tea kettle or coffee pot. We had to order room service for even a cup of tea. We do plan to use this as our Dallas hotel in the future so we'll just request those things to be in the room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mansion for a long Memorial Day weekend. The staff was wonderful, the hotel was immaculate and well cared for. The only suggestion I would have for the hotel is that for a 5 star hotel they really should have updated televisions. Even basic Hilton's have flat screens in them! Other than that the stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Where do we go now that we have had the BEST??”
Reviews.Author: AFBT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent our anniversary at the Mansion on Turtle Creek. Let me just say, OMG! We have stayed at the Mansion several times and have NEVER been disappointed. This time we got the "Escape to Romance" package that includes practically everything you could do possibly do in a one night stay! And when the Mansion offers services, you know it will be done to perfection. We got ... One night accommodations One dozen beautiful long stem roses An iced bottle of champagne with Chocolate covered strawberries Three course dinner for 2 WITH wine pairing Upon returning from dinner there is an Aromatherapy Bath awaiting you and a Rose Petal Turndown! You get a CD of Love songs Monogramed pillowcases In-room movie Delicious american breakfast for 2 2 amazing mansion massages and valet parking All in very luxurious accommodations! Since it was our anniversary they upgraded us to the Presidential Suite, Room 706. This room was phenomenal! It had a full kitchen, 1 1/2 baths, dining area, living room, a baby grand piano, a wet bar, and a master suite with a canopy bed. After we checked in we went down to the pool and relaxed with some refreshing cocktails. Their pool service was excellent and checked with us regularly. The dinner was delicious (as always) and they now have a lovely patio where you can dine al fresco or just have cocktails. The patio overlooks the green-space around Turtle Creek and has two large stone fireplaces, large lanterns for ambient lighting and small brightly colored lanterns hanging from the trees. There was also a very nice fitness center on the 3rd floor you will pass it on your way to the pool! The Mansion also has the best towels and bed linens of any hotel we have stayed with and I LOVE the Lady Primrose bath products! You feel spoiled and pampered; It was more than we could have hoped for! Look at our pictures then go treat yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: neurodoc01
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the mansion. We have enjoyed the stay both times and will definitely stay the next time we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful mansion”
Reviews.Author: fbadaddallas
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic 20th wedding anniversary at this wonderful hotel- starting with the valet parking attendants who didn't let a drop of rain hit my head as I departed my car at the front door to the wonderful receptionist at the front desk (who upgraded us to a premiere room) to the manager who had left us a hand-written note to the attendant who brought us champagne and home-made gingerbread shortly after arriving in our room. The guest room was huge, beautiful, quiet, and elegant. The bathroom was gigantic with a marble bath tub large enought for two and a separate shower with extremely strong water jets wonderfully appointed with Lady Primrose bath products - bath salts and the most wonderfully fragrant and rich cream soap I have ever used. The extraordinary guest room was equally matched by extraordinary service everywhere - everyone made my feel like a very important person (even though I'm not even close)! Loved this place to the Nth degree and for the price I paid for the "Mansion Memories" package that included a fabulous anything-you-want breakfast the next morning in the newl yupdated restaurant, it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: zxttfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a 3 day weekend at the Mansion at Turtle Creek and came away with a great impression of the hotel and it's staff.
