Arriving early on a Friday, we were offered the use of a Lexus for 2 of the 3 days of our stay at no additional charge as well as a multitude of options for sightseeing, shopping, and dining from the conceirge. Mary was outstanding and extremely helpful throughout our stay. The restaurant offers fabulous food for breakfast and lunch (we didn't have dinner) and although pricey, offers great service with wonderful views of the Dallas skyline. We took advantage of the hotel's car service for dinner's out (see review of Yutaka's Sushi Bistro). The rooms were somewhat of a disappointment in that they were outdated but since we didn't spend much time in ours, it wasn't bad. The bed was fairly comfortable and the room offered great space with a comfortable sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “Cotton Bowl perfect”
Reviews.Author: vonkluck
Reviews.Content: We were guests on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday of this past week while in Dallas for the Cotton Bowl. Our room was terrific. Our conceirge services were absolutely first rate. When we came in from a foray to Eddie Deen's for an Ole Miss get together we were invited to join the New Year's Eve party in the lobby area. Hunter Brown's Big Band was really great. The bar area was cozy and luxurious and served as a perfect setting for meeting old college friends for drinks. Our waitress in the bar did an outstanding job. All in all, it was worth the $$$. TOM Southaven, Ms

Reviews.Title: “Grand, Old Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jimbobwe
Reviews.Content: This hotel DOES NOT need updating! It is wonderful just as it is. I would call it a hotel with a lovely patina. It is not a new, modern, trendy Four Seasons or Gaylord. It is the MANSION on Turltle Creek. What does that mean to me? 1. Bed Linens are made by Quagliotti and Carmignani of Italy. Not the the cheap "hotel" lines of Sferra Bros and Frette (Made in China) which are so popular today but in no way compares to the aforementioned. 2. Table Linens are also of Carmignani of Italy. 3. The furniture is all customed made by Beverly Furniture of California. Not bought off of the floor in China but handmade in the USA. 4. The fixtures are gold plated and somewhat worn to a very nice patina. They are not cheap stuff in the latest bronze, platinum, etc finishes. They are what a mansion should have: aged gold finish. No flashy chrome anywhere to be found 5. The doors are solid wood and very heavy. Old. Ditto for the vanity. NO shiny black plastic looking finish, just an aged white hand finish. 6. The bathroom is done in marble and not granite. It doesn't have that ultra shiny finish either. The lighting is very pleasant and without all of those super bright LED , HID bulbs all over the celings. 7. In the restaurant, the men dined in suits and ties. Yes, that's right. The men actually worn ties and none of this open collar, caual nonsense so trendy today. 8. The food and service was truly superb. No fancy colored glass dinner plates or weird coffee saucers etc. (You'll have to go to the 4 seasons for that). 9. When you compare the rate here ($425 incl dinner for two) vs. the 4 Seasons at $895 and up (w/o dinner) you realize what a bargain this place really is. The Gaylord out in Grapevine is $395 for crying out loud!. 10. Ben Stein of Business TV fame was being interviewed in the lobby just prior to dinner. 11. The in-room breakfast ($38.00) was beautifully presented and with the french doors open onto the small balcony you realize how special this place is. They forgot the creamer but brought it up promptly 12. The staff is professional, experienced, helpful and friendly. No arrogance, pomposity, etc unless you prefer it. 13. The plumbing has some issues. When the water drained from one sink the opposing sink made a strange sound that was yet familiar. "That's it! That's sound of the bongo drums from I Love Lucy when Desi would be at the Copacabana warming up." 14. You are fool to miss out on the Mansion on Tutle Creek. 14. My wife loved the experience from the time we left our car until we checked out 24 hours later she could have stayed another week simply enjoying the refined and aged elegance. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwinmama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live nearby in Fort Worth, and thought we'd give the hotel a try to celebrate my birthday. We called early the day of arrival to request an early check-in, and were told the room was ready, which we were happy to hear since I wanted to spend the day at the pool. I skipped lunch at home thinking I'd get a great lunch poolside. When we pulled into the driveway, we were greeted immediately and warmly by the valet and someone came to the car with a luggage cart (even though we had planned on wheeling in our small overnight bags). We were greeted enthusiastically by the concierge, but the front desk welcome was underwhelming, and I thought it odd that the clerk did not review our reservation and discuss the included breakfast. I called later, and was told we had a choice of room service, or choice of menu in the restaurant., but I thought this should have been explained at check-in After getting settled in the room, there was a knock on the door, and room service delivered two glasses of ice tea and one tiny pastry. In spite of there being only one small pastry for us to share, I thought this was a lovely welcome and nice touch. The apple and peach tart was yummy. Although this is a luxury hotel, it is a city location, and as such, the pool area was quite small, but beautifully landscaped. The lounge chairs were wood with cushions (I often evaluate a hotel on the quality of its lounge pool furniture), but there were only 11. Fortunately, two people were leaving, so we were able to get two chairs. There is a sundeck up the stairs with four more loungers, but I like being near the pool since I like to swim. I imagine during the week when there is a business crowd, the pool area is not crowded as it was this holiday weekend. There was a "pool boy" who laid new towels, and gave us a bottle of cold water, which he replenished later in the day. He also moved our chairs into the shade at his suggestion. He gets the award for the best service of the weekend! Lunch at the pool was the only disappointment of the weekend. I ordered a caesar salad from the very limited pool menu, and it was small, way overpriced even by resort standards, and with ordinary boxed croutons. There was a room service delivery charge, so if the salad was an indication of the quality of room service food, we decided we should have our breakfast at the restaurant instead the next morning. Breakfast was excellent, well presented, and not ridiculously priced like the pool menu. We didn't realize the gratuity was included in our package, but you wouldn't have known it by the great service we received. We would definitely return to the restaurant just for breakfast on a weekend. The room had a traditional key lock, and when we checked out, we forgot to return the key since we typically have a card key at other hotels, which we just throw away. The desk clerk did not request the key, so when we realized we still had it, we drove back to the hotel to return it. I would think this is a common occurence since an actual key is so outdated, and thought it odd that the desk clerk did not request it back. Again, we just weren't impressed with the front desk staff compared with the other good service we had received. All in all, a lovely stay, but I don't have an overwhelming desire to return. Based on the good service, though, I would be inclined to stay at other Rosewood properties.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service but Sorely in Need of Updating”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: As a Dallas resident, I have always wanted an excuse to stay at this storied hotel in my own home town. Recently -- due to a small home renovation -- I decided to take a small in-town vacation and booked a room at the Mansion on Turtle Creek. The staff at the Mansion was wonderful -- they anticipated my needs and bent over backwards to be friendly & accommodating. The valet staff in particular deserves kudos for running back and forth for my car in 106 degree Texas heat ! The front desk staff made sure that messages were promptly delivered and were gracious with my frequent service requests. And therein lies the problem. My service requests were frequent -- almost daily. The safe failed to work after I had placed my items inside. The air conditioning unit made a clicking noise every 20 seconds throughout the evening until the staff finally got it fixed about 8 hours later. The hot water took almost 15 minutes to get to the Texas sized soaking tub. (They told me this was due to the low occupancy in the hotel. Huh?) Each time someone flushed a toilet or took a shower the water pressure would make a rushing noise through the plumbing loud enough to be heard in the main bedroom. I could go on but you get the idea. The Premier Room that I was assigned (Room 412) had very dated furniture. Not in a good English country house way but in an overused and confused decorator look. I wasn't hoping or looking for over-the-top but neither was I expecting a return to the 1980's. Honestly, I thought perhaps my expectations were too high so I invited a friend to visit my room and give me her opinion. Shocked may be a slight exaggeration...ok, maybe not. Even she noticed that the black and gold bedding was old and the chenille occasional chair was stained and dirty. The parson's chair at the bathroom vanity was so stained that I laid a towel on it before sitting down. I was sorely disappointed and think most of you reviewers would be better served staying elsewhere -- anywhere else. Sorry Mansion personnel!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Luxury and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: AmberO
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, elegant, classy hotel. It's not huge and almost gives you the feeling of staying at someone's gorgeous home. The lobby is elegant and there are fresh flower arrangements on almost every surface...including the guest room bathrooms. The hotel is famous for their service and we were not let down. The valet service was the best we have ever experienced. They were fast, efficient, friendly, and called us by name. The concierge was equally wonderful booking us spa appointments at the neighboring Rosewood Crescent Court. (which was lovely too) The gym is full of new equipment and stocked with water and fresh fruit. We enjoyed a drink at the hotel bar which had a great bartender who offered us complimentary light snacks with our wine. Our room was the most basic the hotel offers but still had a small balcony and was decorated in soothing pale peach and rose colors. The shower and towels were wonderful and so was the bed and down comforter. My husband called and asked for their "complimentary shoe shine" and his shoes were picked up and returned to us polished in under 15 minutes! Like I said...the service was amazing! We will stay here next time we have a reason to come to Dallas... we felt relaxed and pampered the entire time!

Reviews.Title: “The best.”
Reviews.Author: museumgoer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many hotels over the years, including other Mobil five-star/AAA five-diamond properties, and think this is the best hotel we've ever stayed in. The premises are beautiful, our room was beautiful in a quiet, elegant, comforting way, and the service was attentive and thoughtful without being unctious. Examples: (1) The front desk staff cleared up a slight check-in issue with poise, courtesy, and consideration. (2) The check-in bellman told us the history of the property and a little later slipped under the door a brochure about it; when we went down to eat dinner he walked us over to the restaurant instead of just pointing us in the direction. (3) The housekeeper was somehow able to change towels and do turndown - which included bottles of water with glasses on the nightstands - while we were at dinner, after a "do not disturb" sign had prevented her from doing so earlier. (4) The check-out bellman put chilled bottles of water in our car and wrote out directions to where we needed to go (and it's a nice touch that valet parking doesn't give you a numbered ticket; you just go by your name). (5) As others have written, we were always addressed by name. As for the restaurant, it may not be five stars, but we had a very good dinner with the freshest and tastiest salad greens we've ever had (some of them grown in the hotel's own garden), and a warm and friendly maitre d' who explained the history and architecture of the restaurant and invited us to wander around the private dining/conference areas nearby. Breakfast the following morning was all it should be, with a choice of fresh squeezed juices and eggs any way you like them with whatever you want in them or with them. Breakfast was included in our rate and we never had to mention that to our waiter, who would not even let us add a tip (apparently that was included too). All in all, for us there was nothing not to love.

Reviews.Title: “Weigh the great ambience vs. the inept service”
Reviews.Author: goinglux
Reviews.Content: No strangers to fine hotels, we expected the best upon arrival. Instead, we were told to wait until the check-in staff could help us (one of them was speaking animatedly to a friend). Officious in the extreme. I believe that management doesn't train staff correctly. After the excruciating check-in everything was fine. But what a first impression...! PS: don't expect wonderful skill the restaurant; either they've gone downhill or they had a "bad patch" in March 2008, the only time out of a dozen that we've had absolutely average cuisine there.

Reviews.Title: “First stay, great stay”
Reviews.Author: JdunneKS
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond to accommodate us during our stay. My wife was 8 months pregnant at the time, plus we had our other 4 children with us. The staff at the front desk was amazing during our entire stay (11 days!). There are some other places I'd like to stay next time, but I most likely will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and elegant Dallas legend”
Reviews.Author: TJ70
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mansion for a business trip to Dallas. The staff acknowledged me by name, and they went above and beyond to help me with a couple of last-minute requests. There is something very charming about this hotel and restaurant. It was once a Dallas residential estate, and I think that feeling carries through to the hotel. I had dinner in the Chef's Room one night of my stay. It was very impressive. You start in the salon with champagne and hors d oeuvres. Then, you are escorted to the actual dining room. The room is ornate and looks historic. The food was of a very high quality and creative. We thoroughly enjoyed everything we ordered, and the 3-course menus were so filling. I wasn't hungry the next day. The finishing touch candy cart of home-made candies was a nice detail. Overall, this is a good choice in Dallas. Close to city center with plenty of personality and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service-Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: Everything they say and write about this hotel is true: perfect gem in every way. Hotel is small and intimate and caters to every guest as if they were the only ones in residence. Highlight was dinner in the newly refurbished restaurant which was nothing short of an absolute delight. I selected the vegetarian option & it was one of the best meals of my life (& I've had quite a few Michelin 3 star ones!) Even if you are not staying here, for a very special meal, I would strongly recommend making reservations for dinner one evening. Used the spa at their sister hotel, the Crescent Court, and it was very good but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Mark”
Reviews.Author: skingKansas
Reviews.Content: First, the positive. This hotel is in a great location for visiting all Dallas has to offer. The front desk staff/valet/concierge are very polite and eager to please. We chose this property for the location, outdoor pool and overall reputation of Rosewood. I wished I would've picked a different hotel. First of all, the pool is advertised as being outdoors, but heated so you can swim in it. My children couldn't tolerate it and it felt like it was not heated at all . With temps in the 70's it needed to be. I felt the hotels website was misleading and we wouldn't have stayed there knowing how cold and unswimmable it was. The only time we ate breakfast we felt robbed! I know this is a 5 star property, but our order was messed up, soggy bacon, $6.50 for a cup of coffee and an $80 bill with 2 out of the 4 being from the kids menu. Nothing was exceptional. Three of us got the omelet which was good and I had french toast which was really good, but not that good! Anyway, turn down service was nice, but by 8 o'clock one night we came back to our rooms ready to put the kids down and it hadn't been done. Just a minor thing, but you would think they would know to do it early with a room with children. Also, the bathroom facet was loose and the toilet paper holder was looking as if it needed some TLC. Never did find the ice machine, but I think that is what keep us up part of one night. The doors to the rooms slam shut as well so everytime someone goes in and out you hear it. The coffee and tea are nice in the lobby, but what wouldn't been great is to have a coffee maker in the room! I will end on another positive note, the bottled water at the bedside was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: MegAndJohn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and yet quaint setting.. The room we stayed in was simply luxurious.. The staff was very accomodating and friendly- they treated us very well.. We will definitely return... :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely. Okay.”
Reviews.Author: CJAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mansion over Easter weekend. It was lovely, but after our stay at the Ritz during our last visit to Dallas, it was a tough match. As much as I love the local luxury amenities by Lady Primrose, I agree that the â€œcommunityâ€� bottles seem unsanitary. Room service menu was limited and boring, but when I called to request items not listed, they arrived quickly and were delicious (tortilla soup, chips and guac and a childâ€™s meal). Never before have I been asked at checkout if I took anything from the mini bar. What if I emptied it and drank all the liquor bottles? I wouldnâ€™t want to announce it to the lobby. Isnâ€™t that the point? Indulging in a little something privately? Overall, itâ€™s a pretty hotel with extraordinary history and a good location, but I think weâ€™ll try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: GarethParry
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Mansion on Turtle Creek and must say that I was very imnpressed by the whole experience. I was greeted personally upon my arrival and quickly whisked away to my spacious room, which had an added bonus of a lovely little balcony overlooking the hotel courtyard and provided fresh air to my room. The staff were very hospitable throughout my stay and the concierge helped me with my enquiries promptly and with excellent knowledge. Although I did not sample the food in the highly acclaimed Restaurant, I did hear from a fellow guest that it was excellent. In a city that is fairly large and brash, it has made a very welcome change to stay in a hotel that provide such great old world charm and true service and I would frecommend this property to anyone wanting a nice experience in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely - everything a hotel should be. The lobby is tasteful and welcoming. With the fireplace and comfy couches and chairs, I felt as if I was in my own living room. The service is outstanding, but not in an overbearing way. Sometimes I feel uncomfortable with service that is too attentive, but the Mansion staff knows how to make you feel like a valued guest without going too far. They are willing to assist you with anything you might need. The room is very, very large. I stayed in a Deluxe King, but it almost felt like a suite. There is a huge marble bathroom, a king-sized bed and a sitting area that includes a small balcony. The bed was extremely comfortable. The amenities - in glass bottles rather than plastic, which was a nice touch - were excellent. The only drawback to the room was that there was no flat-screen television, which is something I've become accustomed to in my travels. I ate at the restaurant and utilized the hotel's catering services for an evening event. I was concerned that I would be disappointed, as the Mansion has just lost their chef to the recently opened Ritz-Carlton. Not so. The food was outstanding, possibly the best I have had in a hotel. All around wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: Just got back home from 5 days at the Mansion. Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff but the guest room was dated. I was unable to get one of the few new rooms which have been renovated. My suggestion is to request one of the new rooms when booking your reservation. I have also stayed at the sister hotel Crescent Court, both hotels are decorated with the same fine linens and bedding only major difference was is a sitting area in the standard room at the Mansion. This hotel is not within walking distance to restaurants, but there is a gratis Lexus available to get you to around town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful getaway at the Mansion”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a little break after the Holidays, so we decided to head to Dallas for an extended weekend (we live in Northern Ontario, Canada). The Mansion was everything we wanted, and more. Impeccable service, intimate, in a very upscale part of Dallas, close to shopping, restaurants, etc, etc. There were really just too many good things to list. The rooms were very elegant, as I said before - service was impeccable, the complimentary hotel driver with the beautiful lexus was great for short trips, the bar area was very well done (definitely upscale, but cozy), and the restaurant was beautiful (awesome service, but a little pricey for what the meal was). It was about 30 minutes from the airport, so a little bit of a hike, but not too bad. We also had the fortune to go to the Cowboys Playoff Game (tough loss) and the stadium was about 20 minutes away. All in all, a fantastic experience, certainly deserving of their 5-Star rating. If we're in Dallas again, we're going back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Still the grandest of all, The Mansion on Turtle Creek”
Reviews.Author: miker22
Reviews.Content: Planning to attend several events in the downtown Dallas area, we chose to stay at the Mansion on Turtle Creek because of its location and its reputation for excellence in hotel and dining capacities. Every detail was attended to from the moment we arrived--valet, bellman, the exceptional professionalism of the reception staff and of course our gorgeous suite. This hotel continues to "set the bar" in grand style and with a recently renovated restaurant and lounge areas, there is no comparison. We definitely will return and enjoy this luxury again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Classic Mansion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kctraveler99
Reviews.Content: Wife, 8 year old and I were in Dallas for the Cotton Bowl,, checked in Dec 31 for 2 nights. In Room 710 (next to Presidential Suite). I havent been to the Mansion in over 4 years, but still as I remember it. TALL ceilings in rooms, spacious setting in rooms (nice desk, chairs), giant closet. My room had a French walkout balcony (no view really, just some tree tops, and the hotel courtyard),, It's just a nice way to let in fresh air. King bed very commfy. 100% tiled bathrooms have nice double sinks, deep, deep tub, and a glass in shower. Very thick and large bath towels, and lots of bath amenities (tons of soaps/shampoos) along with fresh flowers in the bathroom too. Standard amenities include 2 times a day cleaning with evening turndown. We ordered room service, and it came up in quick fashion,, hot, and as ordered. Had drinks in --The Bar-- and breakfast in -The Restaurant-. Both places very nice and efficient, and suited to the Top Drawer fashion of the Mansion. Wife had a massage. She also did a AM work out in the gym,, all good she said. The room rate I paid for a -deluxe king- was 395/nt,, and since they did not have any 2 bedded/double rooms,,had to get a rollaway. The rollaway was a bit steep at 40.00/night. Thought they should eat the $40,, but I did not say anything,,just paid it. The only room negative was the TV. It was the --old-- standard 24 inch tube TV. In my home I got rid of the tubes a year ago and I'm spoiled to the HD/flat panel LCD sets. I've been to a ton of nice hotels (Ritz/ Four S. Penninsula, etc) and they all have gone now to flat panels. These tube sets are from the dark ages and should be replaced. They had a --tv volume-- control in the bathroom, but it did not work. Not worth the hassle for me to call and -report- it. The check in/out smooth and efficient as the Rosewood Staff know the game. Car valet and unload/load of baggage very efficient. Keys given and baggage in room with in minutes of arrival. Complimentary coffee and tea all day long in the reception area. All the newspapers you would ever want to read are free in the morning. All in all, a great stay and I would go back for a repeat visit if business/vacation takes me to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: cwtaylor
Reviews.Content: The rate listed on the hotels' web site was too much for my company to pay, so there was another site that poped up called Whatahotel.com I'm so glad I decided to try it. I was able to get a great rate at such an absolutely fabulous hotel. The service, rooms, and the people were the best I have experienced in my 22 years of working in the hospitality industry. I will certainly stay at this hotel whenever I am in Dallas either for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Mansion!!”
Reviews.Author: Tam2005
Reviews.Content: The Mansion was the backdrop for a girls' getaway weekend this summer. I had read a lot about the hotel's reputation, and I have to say that the hotel exceeded my expectations. Every staff person was friendly and exuded charm, and the residential feeling of the public areas and guestrooms made me feel right at home. The rooms were comfortable, and the linens were absolutely divine. We had a room on the first floor with a small garden patio. It was cozy. We especially enjoyed the Mansion Cham Chams (Champagne and Chambord...note: the perfect girls' getaway cocktail!) in the relocated bar. At the time of our visit, the restaurant and bar were undergoing renovation. Though I haven't had the pleasure of visiting Dallas since, I've read about the renovated restaurant and bar. Both sound elegant with a modern touch. I hope to visit The Mansion again soon. This time, maybe I'll bring my husband...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreGrizzy
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be quietly attractive, spotlessly clean with friendly and efficient staff. There is a small, but lovely walled pool area where we enjoyed breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: pbiehler
Reviews.Content: For years I have heard about this hotel. My experience was over the top. From personable concierge service to fantastic pillows, everything exceeded my expectations, with amazing attention to detail For instance, while waiting for the shuttle (which was a luxury town car - not a hotel bus) the concierge served us a glass of champagne and made pleasant conversation about what not to miss in Dallas, as well as historical tidbits about the hotel. The room was complete indulgence...comfy pillows, down comforters and fine linens made me feel completely pampered. Our breakfast in the Promenade, which served an international menu, offered a delicious Mexican favorite of mine and a signature dish of theirs, chiliquitas. Our morning walk consisted of a tour of the hotel grounds. Their beautiful gardens left us with a sense of tranquility. The only disappointment was having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The best service - second to none!!”
Reviews.Author: ADorsett
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mansion on Turtle Creek in Dallas while on business. I can't say enough to describe how fantastic the experience was...everything from the service, to the food, to the luxurious rooms. What started out as a stressful work week turned into a delightful vacation I will never forget!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: sierraskyesmom
Reviews.Content: This was a most impressive hotel. Upon arrival the smell of stargazer lillies and hydrangeas welcomes you immediately. There is an abundance of staff to take care of every need. We stepped into our room and were instantly at home. The Bose radio was set to a nice classical station and the furnishings were top notch. The bathroom ammenities are second to none - complete with a generous supply of bath salts and lotion - both in beautiful crystal containers. His and her sinks cut down on bathroom run-ins, as do the his and her closets. The shower had a very strong stream and the jacuzzi tub was deep and luxurious. Come in after a day of sightseeing and you are greeted by homemade sugar cookies in the shape of cacti and Texas. Bottled water and teas also await. Truly a wonderful extra.

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky good - Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: VermontGolfer
Reviews.Content: This one snuck up on me. I found myself more and more impressed by the Mansion. Here's why the Mansion is sneaky: 1. Its Dallas - who knew? 2. It was pouring at arrival and there was a guy there to grab my bag and hold an umbrella for me to get inside the lobby. 3. Check in was all of a minute. 4. Bellman had my bag the whole time from the point I arrived to the point I entered my room. I never touched the bag - nor did I have to ask for a bellman. 5. Complimentary car service provided by the hotel (sweet ride too). 6. Well done room. Size is right. Bathroom is up to date and well done. 7. Seating area. Plenty of room. Didn't feel like it was squeezed in there. 8. They actually followed up on things. I asked for the WSJ, and it was there on the door handle every morning. The rooms were decorated well, and offered the services you would expect of a fine hotel - minibar, internet, turndown, etc. They were also the right size. I don't think you can have too big of a room, but you certainly can have a room that is too small. For example, the Four Seasons in Maui is too small for the money, and perhaps the Halekulani - but the Four Seasons in Lanai is huge and the Mansions rooms are similar, but not as big as the FS Lanai. My only bark: The rooms need flatpanel tv's. I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but I hear it is good. I had room service (breakfast) it was actually, quite tasty (breakfast taco) and arrived quickly (25 mins). There is a bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KamaLinn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night. It was a great hotel--our room had a queen sized bed with a seperate little area with a couch and TV. We also had some french doors that opened to the outside, but we didn't walk out there (if you could). We arrived in our wedding attire after our 3:00 wedding (around 6:00) and he had already checked us in and put our stuff in the room. We had our bags taken to the room and we were escorted there also. The bathroom was very nice and so was the room. The bed was so comfortable--my husband said that people who stay there often order the beds to have in their own homes! He got a discounted price by going to an online site instead of paying $600 at the hotel. We walked around a little the next morning, but didn't get to see much or enjoy the restaurant. When we checked out, they said, "We'll see you on your one year anniversary." I thought that was a cute little touch. Nice hotel. Expensive, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: gumbytoes
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here...elegant, quiet, very comfortable room. The staff is attentive and ready to serve. We had a delicious breakfast in the beautiful pavillion. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Mansion is the best!”
Reviews.Author: llbGreensboroNc
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Mansion hotel and could not find fault with ANYTHING!!! We travel a great deal, and stay in five star resorts and hotels, and our overall experience was as good as any hotel anywhere. The staff is so friendly and helpful, and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. Our room (deluxe) was so well planned, lots of storage space, esp. in the bathroom. Even though the hotel is 25 years old, everything is as fresh and lovely as when it opened (and we stayed there then, too). It is very close to downtown, and the great shopping and antique stores, yet very residential feeling, and our room was quiet as a tomb and the bed incredibly comfortable. We had room service, cocktails and several meals, all were superb. Their dining room and bar remind you of a beautiful European hotel. Highly recommend!!! Esp. for a special occasion, or entertaining clients as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: parcvue
Reviews.Content: I just spent two days in Dallas and had a great experience at the hotel. Certainly the room decor could be a little fresher and the food was not upto their reputation-but the service and staff are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service, four star rooms, but overall a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Fussy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here en route to Las Vegas from London - thinking we may as well see Dallas rather than just the airport in transit. We booked "escape to luxury" rooms for 3 nights- described as Premier King-450 Sq Ft-marble Bath-garden Tub-Sitting Area-french Doors-private Balcony. The only disappointment was that the description lost something in translation. from American to English, e.g ..."garden tub" does NOT mean a plunge pool, but apparently a larger than average bath tub (firmly fixed in the bathroom) and thef rench doors don't lead to an outdoor sitting area, but to a teeny weeny balcony. HOWEVER, having established that this was what we'd paid for, we relaxed and the iced teas/ coffees and brilliant service more or less made up for the shortcomings in the room and our initial shock at seeing the average size rooms, rather than the splendour and private garden we'd expected. What makes the place is the staff-the concierge gave a great dinner recommendation, and the complimentary drivers as well also took us around the nicer area of Dallas- the free limo is a real boon. The pool area, whilst small, does have sufficient sunbeds to accomodate all that wanted to sit there, and the service and mojos there again superb. All in all a very nice stop over en route to other US cities, and we found the whole Turtle Creek area charming - a great breakfast in the hotel and also (at 1/4 price) in a nearby cafe, BreadWinners that's a pleasant 1/4 hour stroll away. Not sure I'd pay any more for the more expensive rooms given the limited amenities than the price we paid for our room (c 350$ /night) given grounds non existent, and size of pool, but notwithstanding this the hotel has a charm of its own, and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Mansion on Turtle Creek”
Reviews.Author: maminshe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mansion on Turtle Creek following our wedding. Our suite was luxurious, the staff and service was wonderful, and we couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel! From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel special and welcome. We look forward to returning here in the future, and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Truly deserves its fine reputation”
Reviews.Author: David71
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mansion on Turtle Creek was flawless, with an attentive staff, a large, comfortable room, and orchids everywhere. Our plane was delayed by high winds and had to stop on the way to DFW, so we got in serveral hours late, were exhausted and famished. We had room service that was impressive and friendly with truly awesome tortilla soup -- one of their specialties. Can't recommend this place highly enough -- and we are picky and experienced travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Spendy”
Reviews.Author: TeamBell
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying I am a hotel freak and look for different experiences at the beach, in the City, out in the country etc. The Mansion At Turtle Creek was where my hubby and I celebrated Xmas this year and the hotel and amenities were lovely. They had Christmas Carols playing in our room( slightly dated) when we arrived, gingerbread cake, etc. We ate dinner in the main dining area--it was prix-fixe and I was very looking forward to some excellent food. I am not a picky eater and I found the food very salty, my steak was overcooked--personal pet peeve--and loads and loads of garlic. I LIKE garlic,salt etc, just way too much to be in balance at Turtle Creek. Maybe it was because the the restaurant was so heavily booked(?) Room service the next day was excellent.--Also, it was $60 plus tip for breakfast. All in all, we spent a grand in 24 hours. The month prior we got a room on Hotwire.com at the Hyatt --$89, upgraded at check in and our experience was just as nice. I don't mind shelling out the bux every now and again, if it's worth it. Save your money at the Mansion, there are tons of great hotels in Dallas--Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: djm0810
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the MOTC in Dallas for our anniversary. Hotel was just as we expected...pleasant, inviting, and beautiful. Staff was accomodating...not stuffy. Air of elegance and professional service expected in a 5 star hotel. Rooms are oversized, with small,lovely balconies with French doors that fully open. Had a fabulous dinner at the Mansion restaurant. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Blanch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Mansion on Turtle Creek for three nights and couldn't have been more pleased. We expect exceptional quality when we travel. I dream of returning. We picked up a great package off their website and it totally exceeded our expectations. Our room was lovely with a small private garden, a gorgeously appointed bed and a comfortable and tasteful sitting area. Breakfast in the restaurant was fantastic....but dinner was nothing short of amazing. The service throughout our stay was thoughtful, friendly and more than we expected in every way. The doorman and valet even put our sweet old dog Honey's ramp into the car for her when we were ready to leave the hotel. The entire staff was friendly and service was over the top. Being true wine lovers we so appreciated the wines we chose for pairing with all the courses in the tastings menu. All were chosen with the assistance of the very helpful and attentive sommelier. He even sent over a glass of the most perfect Sauterne to go with our foi gras! Our stay was perfect in every way.

HotelInfo.Name: Rosewood Mansion on Turtle Creek
HotelInfo.Address: 2821 Turtle Creek Blvd., Dallas, TX 75219
